Magic Mouse / Keyboard become unpaired – fix or wired replacement?
text:
Both iMacs I own become unpaired upon occasion after powering up. If I didn't have a wired mouse / keyboard I'd be stuck. I have no idea why this occurs but have investigated numerous times. My internet connection is solid. This happens on both computers whether hooked through ethernet or wifi.

I've been considering an iMac replacement however I'd also have to buy adapters for my old wired keyboard / mouse as I use them to access and re-pair the mouse and keyboard when the problem occurs. Do you have any suggestions to fix the issue or ideas I might consider?

Ask HN: What did you buy after reading about it here?
text:
A lot of the books I've bought in recent years came from recommendations here. Usually they weren't even in recommendation threads, but just randomly coming up in comments.

Some are ones you see coming up a lot: The Mom Test, Designing Data-Intensive Applications, Refactoring UI, Don't Make Me Think.

But then some were just way off my radar, like the writings of sociologist Edward T. Hall or Stephen Baxter's sci-fi.

I also bought a lifetime subscription for an app I found here, but mostly it was books.

What did you buy after reading a recommendation on HN?

Show HN: Butt Mover - A butt triggered productivity and health improvement game
text:
Productivity timers needed to be triggered manually before each task, Making it a chore by itself, Often leading to us not using them after a while and They don't take health into consideration.

Health timers are intrusive, Even then they are not always accurate and They don't take productivity into consideration.

Butt Mover addresses those problems by using a butt trigger for automatically starting the productivity timer when we sit on the chair before our workstation and a break timer which reminds us to take a walk automatically when we get up.

Butt Mover also incentivizes its usage through a Game. When the health(tasks/breaks) reaches zero its game over.

I've been iterating different forms of Butt Mover over past two years and released the web application earlier this year(After feedback from several HN users). Today I'm making the core application open-source as I've committed myself to make the Health & Education applications I build open-source.

I hope you'd use Butt Mover for yourself and build Butt Trigger for others to improve productivity and health. Feedback and contributions to improve the project is appreciated.

Ask HN: Any open source text editors with word tagging?
text:
I am looking for a text editor where users can tag words with meta data. "Jhon doe started the car." -> John doe <person>, car <vehicle>

I want these tags to be programmable/exportable so that when we process the document, I can process based on custom rules. Eg. Different colours for person, objects, location , Show summary in the side panel etc .

Ask HN: Has anyone taken this OOUX course? Opinions?
text:
Hello HN!!!

I'm a youngling when it comes to UX/UI, I've actually stumbled on this type of work in my last working situation, and now I'm just finishing my Google certification via Coursera.

In my initial search for courses for UX/UI design I stumbled across Sophia Prater's website and podcast and have been trying to implement some of the teachings she's released while completing my Google UX design cert aside from reading her released educational items.

https://www.ooux.com/

I would just like to know if anyone has actually taken her masterclass and/or self-paced course, what did you think about it, what is good/bad about utilizing it in real project situations in your opinion, and was the certification worth it or is the self-paced class enough?

I found a supplementary course for interaction design and another for psychology driven design that I will be taking, so I'm basically trying to figure out if this is a worthwhile course to undertake as well.

Thanks for letting me pick your brains!
